meanings.sent1: She reburies her beloved pet in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist reburies the ancient remains with respect.
meanings.sent3: The zombie reburies itself every night, only to rise again at dawn.
meanings.sent4: Time reburies the past, but memories remain unearthed.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain quickly reburies the buried treasure under mud.

meanings.definition: To place (something) in the ground again.
meanings.sent1: He reburies the time capsule for future generations to discover.
meanings.sent2: The gardener reburies the bulbs deeper for better growth.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel reburies the acorns all over the garden.
meanings.sent4: The storm's aftermath reburies the fence post in the soft soil.
meanings.sent5: The child happily reburies the toy car in the sandbox for a new adventure.
